186000298.review: As deep as the community's love for this game is, I've never quite cared for it. I'm not sure why as I've played through and beaten most other Fromsoft games, and enjoyed them all quite thoroughly. However, DS1 always felt obtuse to me, and not in a particularly fun way. Granted, I suck at this game. I can solo DS2 and 3, I've played the hell out of Elden Ring and love Bloodborne, but this game kicks my ass like no other. Still, its a classic. And until Fromsoft completely loses touch with what makes them great, they'll always have my support.

185687101.review: I liked this game a lot.

185625545.review: El mejor mapa creado por Fromsoftware, Y eso ya es decir muchisimo.

185625423.review: Jogo clássico da franquia Dark Souls e um dos formadores do gênero soulslike. Neste jogo dentre todas as mecânicas e elementos de um jogo souls, certamente o ponto alto fica no level design dos mapas que surpreende a cada atalho ou novo setor do mapa que conhece e também a sensação de recompensa / punição durante a exploração. Como pontos de atenção, com esta versão, a movimentação é um pouco limitada, por exemplo: a esquiva não pode ser feita na diagonal, a câmera que por vezes pode atrapalhar em alguns momentos e o cenário também pode ser um desafio. Contudo, recomendo muito para quem gosta do gênero e tem interesse de experimentar como a franquia foi evoluindo.

185556316.review:
Se você gosta do jogo pois jogou no lançamento, não rejogue.
O jogo na verdade é bem insuportavel, os mapas não fazem sentidos, e o design level é porco. Todos os mapas são péssimos e a unica dificuldade que o jogo te entrega são de ir de A para B, onde inimigos vão te derrubar, não enxergará nada etc. Os bosses são bem esquisitos, a maioria é patetica de facil, apenas 2 ou 3 bosses realmente valem a pena. No geral, parece que você anda e anda no jogo, e como recompensa, ganha um boss ridiculo para seguir em frente. 
Fraquissimo.

185500527.review: If I had to describe this game in a single word, it would be "tedious".  The combat is challenging, sure, but it feels like most of the game's "difficulty" comes in the form of the game trying to inconvenience the player and waste their time at every opportunity.  Most of the non-boss enemies you fight aren't particularly difficult or challenging, but they can do a lot of damage to you if you slip up.  Bosses are far from checkpoints, meaning that you need to run through segments of the game as perfectly as possible or else you'll be at a resource disadvantage during boss fights.  The decisions made by the developers feel archaic at best and outright hostile at worst.  Extremely unfun experience.  Do not recommend.

185487565.review: incredibly fun to play and very rewarding. recommend!

185464952.review:
Dark Souls is more than just a game, it’s an odyssey of challenge, discovery, and triumph that has earned its reputation as one of the most influential titles in modern gaming. Developed by FromSoftware, this spiritual successor to Demon’s Souls introduced the world to the dark, brutal, and intricately designed kingdom of Lordran, captivating players with its unforgiving difficulty and deeply rewarding gameplay.

At its core, Dark Souls is about learning, growth, and perseverance. Every enemy, every boss, every inch of Lordran is a test of your skill, patience, and determination. Death isn’t a punishment but a lesson, urging you to adapt, strategize, and try again. The combat system, characterized by its weighty, deliberate feel, demands precision and mastery. Each swing, roll, and parry carries consequences, turning even minor skirmishes into thrilling encounters.

The world of Lordran is a masterpiece of interconnected design. From the moment you set foot in Firelink Shrine, the game encourages exploration, rewarding curiosity with shortcuts, hidden paths, and treasures. The seamless way areas like the Undead Burg, Blighttown, and Anor Londo connect creates a sense of place and discovery that few games can match. The atmosphere is oppressive yet mesmerizing, with crumbling ruins, foreboding forests, and majestic yet decayed architecture painting a picture of a world on the brink of collapse.

The storytelling is subtle and enigmatic, unfolding through cryptic dialogue, item descriptions, and environmental clues. Instead of spoon-feeding a narrative, Dark Souls invites players to piece together its lore and themes. It’s a story of cycles, despair, and fleeting hope, where the fates of gods and mortals intertwine in tragic ways. The ambiguity gives the world an air of mystery, making every revelation feel earned and impactful.

Boss battles are the game’s defining moments, each presenting unique challenges that test your reflexes, strategy, and resilience. Whether it’s the iconic encounter with the towering Iron Golem, the haunting beauty of the Abyssal Artorias, or the relentless aggression of Ornstein and Smough, these fights are unforgettable, blending spectacle with substance.

The game’s mechanics emphasize personal growth. The bonfire system serves as both a sanctuary and a risk-reward mechanic, while the leveling system allows you to tailor your character to your preferred playstyle. Whether you wield a hulking greatsword, delicate sorceries, or a trusty shield and spear, Dark Souls offers a wealth of options for creative builds.

The haunting score by Motoi Sakuraba underscores the emotional weight of the game, with somber melodies accompanying moments of quiet reflection and thunderous orchestration heightening the intensity of boss encounters.

Dark Souls is not a game that holds your hand, and its difficulty can be intimidating for newcomers. Yet, for those willing to embrace its challenges, the game offers a sense of accomplishment and mastery that few others can match. It’s not just about beating the game, it’s about conquering yourself, pushing through frustration, and emerging stronger on the other side.

For its groundbreaking design, unforgettable world, and deep, meaningful gameplay, Dark Souls remains a titan in the gaming world. Whether you’re a first-timer or a returning champion, venturing into Lordran is an experience that will leave an indelible mark on your gaming journey. Prepare to die, and to fall in love with the beauty of the struggle.

185258026.review:
So I decided to Play the Original Dark Souls for the first time,  the " Prepare to Die" Addition, and I beat the game in about a week with the DLC. It was a unique experience with some pretty good boss battles, and some good locations to explore, however I do feel like this game gets a little bit too much praise, even for it's time. This game came out in 2011, Borderlands 2 came out in 2012....

             I 100%ed the achievements on steam on NG +4, and Guess what? This has to be one of the most over hyped games of all time, with the most die hard edge lords defending it known to mankind; it's kinda cringe. I remember seeing everyone praise this game when it came out, back in 2011, for being hard and captivating. I don't see many talking about the downsides of this game, and its short comings. I found myself online a lot of time,  reading up on forms about players going through similar issues that I was having with the game. 

               After playing the game and actually breaking down the game elements, I just felt a huge disconnect. Putting in another ~20hrs into gameplay after beating the game has made me see even more flaws in development choices with enchanted weapons, boss enchantment weapons, hidden buffs/debuffs on equipment, spells, ect. This game does a poor job on informing its players(in-game) and its a big f*** you by the Devs, and it does it on a really shit engine with a terrible character control model, and with dog shyt hitbox's and collision boxes. I'm all for shitting engines and graphics when the control models are tuned in,  but this game just has a lot of dog shyt moments.  

              I like the game's aura and esthetics, and I believe it's the main reason why it popped off back in 2011. However for me this is mediocre game, with alright moments and stagnant lows. The hyped killed it for me, I tried to go into this game blind to get an authentic experience and was left disappointed. I beat this game in 1 week with the DLC and the hardest boss was Manus on NG+,  if it wasn't for the Devs sh!ty game philosophy I would have smoked his ass on the Default playthrough.  

           To conclude this rant, the lows of this game sit at 4/10 and the highs sit at 7/10, this game hovers around a 5/10 or a 6/10 for me..... Uninstalled.

184882297.review:
Original Review: I know people like this game, but I have no desire to replay the same sections of levels over and over again until I'm perfect at it, especially when there is little to no instruction as to what things do. I also have no desire to spend the amount of time and dedication to a game that punishes you for being a casual player. I won't be getting any of the subsequent games.

Update: I wanted to give the game more of a chance. Turns out, on the 2nd level, there are 3 directions you can go. 2 of them lead to impossible death, while 1 is the way you're supposed to go. The problem is, the route you're supposed to go is much hard to find than the other 2 routes, which are plain as day. I ended up having to start over because I used up all of my items, humanity, and souls trying to go the 2 impossible routes. Now that I know which way to go, the game isn't quite as punishing. I'm still not thrilled about the lack of explanation as to how things work since wasting items on experimentation is not something you can afford to do in this game. I find myself often looking up information in guides, which to me should be a last resort. That tells me this game wasn't made well. It's still enjoyable, but it's got a fair amount of critical flaws.

184602307.review: Antes do remake e antes de você tirar as fraldas eram aqui que as coisas eram resolvidas: em um teste de masoquismo e paciência que te forjou para o futuro distôpico dos gatchas de hoje dia. Dito isso, esse aqui é o melhor e da série Souls quanto ao level design e dificuldade. Não fica repetitivo zerar mais de uma vez por quê sempre você vai achar um modo novo de morrer. Esse jogo é o divisor de águas: não tem método melhor de inserir uma experiência multijogador em um jogo semi-linear tão bem feito quanto este jogo apresentou.

184145618.review:
This game is unfinished. FromSoft never fully realized this game but the bits they do well they do Exceedingly well. 
The combat is fun, 
the bosses are punishing if you're unprepared but rewarding to learn the attack patterns of, 
there's a ton of options for equipment and a decent number for stats in game.
The world Mostly feels rich and full of intrigue (note: the latter bits of the main game are lacking in this regard)

What sets this game apart from the rest of the souls series is how well the areas are interconnected. Each environment is weaved into the next - tightly knit. Other souls games feel more like a sprawling world, this one feels like a twisted tower.

184109092.review: by far the most relaxing gaming experience ive ever had the pleasure of playing

184057205.review:
I did not have much opportunity to get very far in the game. I played it a long time ago and I had *horrible* issues with getting it to run. When things seemed well and I wanted to play multiplayer, I was never able to due to crashes and errors. The frustration related to the game refusing to run accordingly was to an extent where I will never give it another shot.

Although I played it a long time ago, I still felt the need to post this. I've heard it's a great game, but no game should be on the market for someone to buy with so many problems. It's a standard I don't believe should exist or be accepted to such a large extent.  I highly recommend checking out some of their other games... the ones with a more reasonable amount of stability issues.
